author: NEW YORK DAILY NEWS
title: NYC man uses religious reasons to delay charges in officer slay
text:
A Brooklyn man accused of shooting a correction officer to death as she sat inside her car delayed facing murder charges Friday because of religious reasons.
Keon Richmond has been held a Suffolk County jail since he and his girlfriend Shirley Mejia were busted in December for torching woman’s car until police continued to investigate them for the murder of his ex-girlfriend Alastasia Bryan.
The 25-year-old rookie correction officer was shot five times as she made a phone call in her car at E. 73rd St. and Avenue L on Dec. 4.
Richmond, 33, and Mejia were charged Thursday in connection with Bryan’s murder.
Brooklyn man charged in murder of correction guard ex-girlfriend 
The couple were expected to be arraigned in Brooklyn Supreme Court Friday, but Richmond told his attorney Gregory Watts that he was unavailable.
“I spoke to him this morning, he’s at a Suffolk County jail, and he said for religious reasons, he cannot be here (Friday),” said Watts to Brooklyn Supreme Court Justice Matthew D’Emic.
Shirley Mejia appears in Brooklyn Superior Court Wednesday, Dec. 21, 2016 on the charge of arson. She and her boyfriend, Keon Richmond, are accused of torching another woman's car. (Barry Williams /New York Daily News) Mejia’s arraignment for hindering prosecution charges was also put off.
If convicted, she faces up to seven years in prison.
Accused jail guard killer’s girlfriend busted in NYC car fire 
A law enforcement source said Richmond recently became a Muslim. If convicted, Richmond faces 25 years to life in prison for the second-degree murder charges.
Their cases were adjourned until next Wednesday.
